result.execSummary:
The defendant Jaquell D. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Extended Supervision conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
 ** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay DNA surcharge.    If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. May not have contact with victim. Review hearing on 8/9/16 @ 9 a.m. (hold open Ct 1 ).    Probation and Parole to provide written report by 8/6/16.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

superMiscConds.notes:
**ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied. Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. 
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*** ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILLTO BE COLLECTED***   May not have contact with victim.

records.addlTxt:
Ct 2 - 2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6mos of ES
Ct 1 - consec 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.

Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP on either count

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Hilary Edwards.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  NOTE - deft's pending charges were considered by the Court for this sentencing hrg.  In the event the deft is exonerated of those charges, that may be a new factor for consideration of re-sentencing.

Count 2 - deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos followed by 6mos ES.  Credit for 294 days.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Count 1 - sentenced to consecutive period of 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligilbe for CIP or SAP

Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.
email sent to attys re: sentencing hrg 8/26/16 @ 10am

from State to defense counsel - State's motion to revoke hold open set for 8/9/16 @ 9am
to Revoke Hold Open Agreement - filed by the State
948.03(2)(b) - Physical Abuse of a Child - Intentinoally Cause Bodily harm / Repeater  - Ct 1 only - Deferred Prosecution
Per clerk, Judge wants $500 cash bond effective for this case. Sending amended cash bond to jail.
Email received from Agent Merlin - deft has violations of probation; DOC is pursuing revocation.  If deft is not revoked - agent to notify the court for a possible RH

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Sentencing arguments made (Ct 2) - sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Deft given conditional jail time as a condition of probation commencing forthwith.  Huber allowed if working.  Sentencing on count 1 - 8/9/16 @ 9am. 

Appeal rights
Paperwork from Lake County Illinois re DE
Stipulated hold open agreement for 12 months

Minutes:  15CF513/15CM631.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Victim rights compliance.  Cases are resolved.  Stipulated hold open agreement filed.  Court will not accept the agreement with the change on the first page under number (1).  Brief discussion held.  Attys agree to leave this language in the hold open agreement.

15CM631 - dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

15CF513 - second amended information filed.  On Count 1 - deft pleads guilty; admits to repeater.  Judgment w/held.  Sentencing date will be addressed at the next hrg on 8/7/15.  On Count 2 - deft pleads guilty; admits to repeater.  Found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing set over to 8/7/15 @ 10am.  Court requests ADA Kraus contact Lake County State's Atty office to request a copy of the complaint, information, and/or PSI.  Arguments heard on deft's bond motion; bond motion denied.  Bond to continue as fixed.
Ct 1 Physical abuse of a child Ct 2 - Battery

Minutes:  15CF513/15CM631.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Cases are resolved.  Court commences plea colliquey w/deft; colliquey interruped - hrg adj to 7/17/15 @ 10am.  Issues raised by court - errors contained the complaint as well as whether a plea can be taken on the battery and the child abuse since there is only one incident of injury to the child.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hilary Edwards. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-16-15 @ 9:50am.  Jury selection on 8-24-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.

404pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 6/11/15 @ 915am.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/GJF (dob 10/26/99), JMF (dob 8/22/02), and Lakisha R F or their residences.
